title: Henley Passport Index 2025: An Asian powerhouse secures top spot; Indian passport weakens - The Economic Times
summary:
Henley Passport Index 2025: Singapore Retains Top Spot as India Drops Ranks

Publication Date: 2025-01-01 Source: Economic Times

Singapore has reclaimed its crown as the world‚Äôs most powerful passport in 2025 with visa-free access to 195 of the 227 global destinations, according to the annual Henley Passport Index. India has fallen five places in this year's rankings from 80th to 85th.

Key Points:

  • Singapore ranks first with access to 195 destinations.
  • Japan ranks second with access to 193 destinations.
  • Six EU countries share third place, offering access to 192 destinations.
  • The US passport has dropped to ninth place with access to 186 destinations.
  • India now provides access to 57 countries, sharing its rank with Equatorial Guinea and Niger.
  • Pakistan and Yemen share 103rd position, with access to 33 destinations.

Top 10 Most Powerful Passports:

1Singapore195
2Japan193
3Finland192
3France192
3Germany192
3Italy192
3South Korea192
3Spain192
4Austria191
4Denmark191
‚ÄúIndia's passport strength has weakened significantly, as evidenced by its drop in rankings.‚Äù

The Henley Passport Index highlights shifts in global mobility and the importance of passport strength in diplomatic relations.
newTitle: Henley Passport Index 2025: Singapore Retains Top Spot as India Drops Ranks

title: Joe Biden reveals unexpected compliment he received from Donald Trump, ‚ÄòHe thought I was leaving with‚Ä¶‚Äô - Hindustan Times
summary:
Joe Biden reveals unexpected compliment he received from Donald Trump

Date: January 09, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In an interview with USA Today, President Joe Biden shared that he received a compliment from former President Donald Trump regarding his economic record. Biden reflected on his potential to have defeated Trump in the presidential election and expressed uncertainty about pursuing another term.

  • Biden claims he could have beaten Trump had he not dropped out of the race.
  • Trump complimented Biden on his economic achievements.
  • Biden stated, 'It's presumptuous to say that, but I think yes' when asked about his chances of winning.
  • He expressed uncertainty about another full term, questioning, 'Who knows what I'm going to be when I'm 86 years old?'
  • Biden dropped out of the 2024 race on July 21, 2024, endorsing Kamala Harris.
Biden: 'The only advantage of being an old guy is that I've known every major world leader for a long time.'

In conclusion, Biden's reflections highlight his confidence in his leadership record while navigating the complexities of politics as he approaches the end of his term.

title: Indian-American doctor who kept two Indians as servants on low pay loses medical license - Deccan Herald
summary:
Indian-American Doctor Loses License for Exploiting Servants

Published: 09 January 2025
Source: Unknown

Dr. Harsha Sahni, an Indian-American physician, has had her medical license permanently revoked for illegally harboring two Indian women as low-paid household servants.

  • Dr. Sahni pleaded guilty to conspiracy to conceal and harbor aliens and to filing a false tax return.
  • She was sentenced to 27 months in prison starting October 2024.
  • The State suspended her medical practice in September 2023 while revoking her license.
  • Attorney General Matthew J. Platkin called the case disturbing, highlighting the abuse of vulnerable victims.
  • Sahni admitted to not paying taxes for her workers and providing them inadequate compensation.
‚ÄúThere is no place in the medical profession for this kind of criminal conduct and utter disregard for humanity.‚Äù - Attorney General Platkin

This case underscores the need for ethical standards within the medical field and the serious consequences of exploitation.
